title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Simple, common questions. fast, but boring, essentially felt like read off a questionairre from online, no originality. nice people interviewed, courteous, friendly. good overall to get a feel for the company overall
Interview Questions: how i handle things under time constraints

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: First, I applied online and then I was told to go to an in-person recruiting event. After meeting the nurse manager for the unit I was applying to at the event, I set up an online interview with them. At the end of the online interview, they offered me the job.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were fairly predictable. They asked why I wanted to work in healthcare, why I think I'm the right fit for the job, asked about a time where I had to handle conflict, and a time where I felt like I really made a difference. They also left plenty of time for me to ask questions about the role and gave me informative, detailed answers.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter reached out for initial questions such as what experience I bring/tell them about myself. It was a 10-15 minute phone call. Recruiter said if I passed initial interview, there would be 2 more interviews with manager and team.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself what's your salary expectations what do you know about CRM?

title: Patient Engagement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Interview process via phone and no follow up - phone screening lasted about 30 minutes. Eady to talk to the recruiter but no sense of how you are meeting the par
Interview Questions: What are my strengths and weaknesses

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: interviewed with the manager. interview was informal, more like conversational. asked some HR questions then about your experience, education, training, current position. why do you want this position? your availability
Interview Questions: How do you keep up with current guideline?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: I walked on to the unit and asked the front desk receptionist for the Nurse Manager. Once we were introduced, she brought me into her office with the ANM and they proceeded to ask me questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you decide to become a nurse?

title: Registered Nurse GI Lab Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and understanding . I didn’t feel pressured. Showed me the GI lab and its in and out. Spoke only to manager and saw the nurses in the floor
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult interaction with doctor

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Was more of an interrogation. Tried to offer me based off of no experience vs. my 7 years of experience. Was exasperated by the interrogation, I told her I was only in it for the health insurance anyway. She backed down, seeing I was exasperated. Total mess of an interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening with HR (about qualifications and pay and availability), then promptly moved on to a virtual interview with PI. Very quick to set up appointments, and interview leaned more towards casual and focusing on research goals.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your time at [lab] and what skills you felt confident in by the end of your time there.

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: quick and simple phone interview with recruiter and then an in person interview with the unit nurse manager. had a walk through of the unit and was introduced to some employees and my responsibilities
Interview Questions: previous experience how to handle difficult situations

title: Director IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews with a variety of people. 7 people total, some were combined panel interviews and some were 1:1 interviews. They stretched over several weeks.  Communication was handled well, and discussion oriented, very friendly.
Interview Questions: Tell me when you had a project that failed and what you learned.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: I had opportunity to shadow nurses in the unit I am interviewed for before my actual interview. The shadow gave me the ideas about the responsibilities and requirements for this position, and more importantly, I knew that the job was good fit for me! The actual interview was straightforward and enjoyable. The hiring managers asked me about my vision within next couple years, my strength/weakness, and last asked me about how to deal a conflict with a coworker.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a conflict with a coworker, how you resolve it?

title: Learning & Development Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Arlington Heights, IL) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen with HR, then remote interview with a department executive, then an in-person interview with two managers on the team, and finally an in-person sample presentation to about 15 or so people. I applied in May. My first interview (after the phone screen) was in early June. After going through essentially 4 rounds of interviews, the last of which being in mid-July, they were extremely unprofessional and uncommunicative regarding their decision, which they told me they would have within 1-2 weeks. I tried following up with them to ask if they'd made a final decision and they ignored me until October (again, my final interview was in mid-July), when they finally decided to tell me they hired someone internally. Not only unprofessional, but a colossal waste of time.
Interview Questions: How would you determine if your training initiatives are effective?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Glenview, IL) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Talked about potential contributions I would bring if joining the team as well as ways I would need to improve as an employee. Discussed how the clinic runs and the different resources available (e.g., treatment rooms, equipment).
Interview Questions: What strengths can you bring to the team?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview.  Explained position in detail.  Office setting and location.  Discussed what I was looking for and how I would be a good fit for the job.  Pay scale was also provided.
Interview Questions: How my past experience would be used in this position?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard interview process. Met in the office of human resources. Asked me questions about why I wanted the job and I could bring to the department. Stated that I could bring my youth, knowledge, and enthusiasm.
Interview Questions: What is the reason you would like to work in this department?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Application online then a phone Interview with HR representative for pre screen questions. Schedule a meeting with department manager/director who explains roles and responsibilities and then peer interview within department.
Interview Questions: Explaining my experience and relevance to new position

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was with a panel of four managers. They had a lot of ques. Overall it was a pleasant experience . The difficulty level was average. Most of the questions were regular interview questions for this position.
Interview Questions: How do you think this job will help you in your future career goals?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty smooth - HR phone screen, 1:1 interview with hiring manager, panel interview with team Questions focused on research abilities and scenarios that may occur while in the role. Entire process took about 2-3 weeks from initial screen to offer letter.
Interview Questions: How will you navigate communication between the research team and clinical team?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Very simple just a conversation with the manager who asked basic questions like why are you interested in this position and name a time you managed a conflict with others.
Interview Questions: What are your future career goals?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: I received a tour, met with the rehab supervisor, then two team members without the supervisor. Overall, not intimidating. Typical interview questions. Then HR reached out to me to have a short phone meeting.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at our hospital

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a pretty normal two round process. The people were very nice and enthusiastic about me being there. Prepare yourself for basic interview questions and you should do great.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick, however I was called back for a second interview and then waited a couple weeks for final offer. They had to interview other candidates as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experience

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I met with HR first and then was brought to the manager who interviewed me. The interviewer went through a list of questions that seemed to be on an interview guide. After the interview, I was shown around on the floor.
Interview Questions:
Why nursing?
What do you look for in a manager?
Where do you see yourself in six years?
What do you find difficult about nursing?
Describe a difficult situation you experienced.
What makes a good and bad day for you?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Connection with human resources for a phone screen for about 10-15 minutes 
Then moved on to met with supervisor for ~30 minute interview 
HR got in contact with me in the next couple days to discuss next steps
Interview Questions:
Experience bringing to role 
Career plans

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview with PI, then group interview with lab members book ended by HR phone calls. Will most likely have to submit 2 to 3 letters of recommendation via email. Pretty casual, just have to show you are able to learn new skills.
Interview Questions: How long can you stay? Career goals? Scientific Experience?

title: Social Work/Crisis Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: After applying I was contacted directly by the director of the program. Brief phone informational interview, about 15 minutes. Followed by in-person interview with director, opportunity to meet direct supervisor
Interview Questions:
What is your experience in hospitals
Knowledge of suicide screening

title: Software Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had 5 meetings with hiring manager, team members and managers of other teams associated with , people were friendly, asked many questions on my experience, involving both technical and inter-personal skills.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with AWS ?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: On phone. 2 interviews. Very transparent & straightforward. First interview was more descriptive of position. Second interview was to make sure we were a good fit fit each other.  They looked hard at my resume. Used resume builder online- super easy!
Interview Questions: A time when I went above & beyond for a patient.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR, unit manager and then a unit tour followed. Once completed, a interview with the staff was scheduled to get to know the night and day shift. Overall process was not easy.
Interview Questions: What made you want to be a nurse

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and during the interview it was welcoming and it felt like I was having a normal conversation. The conversation flowed really well and I got hired immediately.
Interview Questions: How I have dealt with a conflict with a coworker

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: They asked about 6 behavioral questions "name a time when you..." HR seemed very short and rushed through questions. Followed up by interview with managers of the unit who asked questions specific to the unit. "why do you want to work in this unit"
Interview Questions: Name a time you experience conflict?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: The preamble was professional and efficient  but the lack of follow through or constructive feedback to an internal candidate was disappointing.  I was unable to get a response from anyone after the interview process.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview was quick and easy. In person interview was with manager of unit and recruiter. Interview went as long as 1-2 hours. Wear business casual and be prepared to answer any questions. They were very nice and welcoming, willing to teach you as well and walk you through what they want to hear from you!
Interview Questions:
What would a busy day look like for you?
Why did you choose this job?

title: Staff Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then set up a phone interview, then  filled out forms once I was offered the position and set up a time for physical evaluation.  It was a family simple interview process.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to become a nurse

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough.  Asks basic interview questions. Come prepared. Gives a tour of the hospital. Talk about your experience and why you want to work there. Not an overwhelming process. Be confident.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult patient

title: Staff Nurse (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the application online, I worked with a recruiter and had two phone screens. Then there was an on site in person interview with managers. All were way easy to coordinate, and all flowed like conversations.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions, situational questions, not very many clinical questions.

title: ER Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy, awesome interview. I had to complete a pop quiz which was kind of a turn off but it was simple.  I got to tour the ER department and the staff was very warm and welcoming.
Interview Questions: How was my day going?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Pretty quick and easy. Make sure you come prepared and bring your resume with you. It really depends on your hiring manager and how they are.  Everything is pretty fine and you will be fine.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weakness?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then was contacted a few weeks later to come in for an HR interview followed by an interview with the nurse manager of the floor I applied to. The HR interview was fairly straightforward and simple, but the interview with the nurse manager went on for quite some time (around 1.5 hours). She asked unique, hard hitting questions that I had never been asked in a nursing interview before. While I appreciate this, there were some that I wasn't prepared for.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a good day on the floor

title: Employee Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online (application was extremely lengthy), was called almost 12 minutes late by the recruiter for a brief phone screening then invited in for an in-person interview.  I didn't receive confirmation until the day of the interview and the instructions were so vague I ended up having to bother everyone that walked by to find the right building.  During the in-person, I met with the Manager of Employee Relations.  I was turned completely off by her statement that she was 'not empathetic' but expected others to be.  This is not a good reflection of what is to be expected for a solid HR leader.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with manager, phone interview with HR. In person HR, in person manager and in person with the team. It was good to hear from the team and ask them specific questions without manager present.
Interview Questions: How do you manager your time

title: Radiation Technician Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Highland Park, IL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process takes a while just for them to put you on the program. The interview process was the entire day, but it took a while to get an in person interview and hearing back from them.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with somebody that is going through a tragedy?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: I got an email setting up a date and time for a phone interview first , hr interview in person and after meeting with recruiter I was walked to my department for an inperson interview with the manager of department/lead interview
Interview Questions: how would you describe yourself, what is your strength, why are you leaving your current job, how well do you get along with your coworkers, what was your relationship with your boss.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Nurse recruiter initiated phone screen process and eased into asking about experience, and day to day tasks from previous work performances and jobs. Then proceeded to move forward with an interview with a clinical nurse manager.
Interview Questions: Based on your experience and skills, why are you a great fit and what

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was good. they asked a lot of good questions. i was happy to interview there. i hope they call me back. if not i will call and interview for another position.
Interview Questions: what is your availability to work

title: BSN- RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Highland Park, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Simple, easy, and empathy based questions (same as listed above).  No reason to stress. Clean environment and comfortable, hiring process did take a bit of a delay however especially with getting organized even though they want you to start right away...
Interview Questions: Empathy based questions, can't think off top of my head.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I appled online, went in for the job fair. The process went by fairly quickly spoke with a nurse she asked a few questions went to another room to fill out background paper work. Next I had a interview with I suppose the Call Center Manager. The questions Where fairly easy, there definately was an emphasis on being empathetic and showing up to work. Easy interview overall.
Interview Questions: Hiring process

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with HR followed by an in-person interview with the Principal Investigator. I was asked to come in a second time to meet with the VP, and had a rather short conversation with him. Overall,  it was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Was refereed to hr by colleague. Received a phone call the same day to schedule an interview. Call screen lasted about 10 min asking general questions. Came in for interview, they were very pleasant and provided a complete understanding of the entire hiring process from start to finish. All questions asked were generic behavioral questions. Refer to your experience and you should be fine.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you improved a situation?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied in July. I got an email to complete a phone interview during the last week of August. I had the phone interview during the first week of September. My in-person interview was during the last week of September. It was with the hiring manager first, then the two unit mangers. I got an offer about a week after and accepted. The entire process was about 3 months.
Interview Questions: Why Northshore?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Highland Park, IL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the nurse recruiter and answered a couple questions on the phone. After I had a 1:1 interview with the nurse recruiter and then following a 1:1 with the manager for the unit I planned on working for.
Interview Questions: I was asked how I handled conflicts among coworkers in my previous jobs

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: The first interview consisted of a meeting with an HR Rep who was very friendly. The Representative asked a few behavioral interview questions that required some forethought. The Rep seemed very positive about the company as a whole & made the process simple.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: After I applied, I got an email asking what days I am available for a short phone interview. After the phone interview, she asked me when I am available to come in for an I person interview with HR. During that interview I was testing on my typing skills. At the end of the interview, since he liked me, he asked me when I am available for a second interview. During that second interview I was in a room with 3 people and each of them were asking me questions. It’s called a panel interview. A week later I got a call to come in for a last interview one on one.
Interview Questions:
How did you handle a difficult customer? 
Give details !!

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 days. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Filled out the application online, emailed by HR 4-8 weeks later to schedule phone screening, phone screen then in person interview followed by shadowing of a current employee for a few minutes to see if you like the job.
Interview Questions: Name a time you were challenged ethically at work.

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with four different managers who are also technical people--a director, my manager, and two other managers of related IT groups.  Unlike many other interviews, they were welcoming to a candidate whose experience was with a different ETL tool from the one they use (I've been a DataStage programmer, and they have Informatica).  One manager specifically said, "As long as you understand the concepts, learning the tool will be easy." which is a breath of fresh air in today's recruiting market.
Interview Questions: Many specific SQL questions to be worked out on paper there in the room.  Not sure I can remember specifics, but they ranged from trivial to complicated.  Also, basic UNIX questions like "How do you see the available space on a disk mount point?"  And "How can you look at the fifth record in a file?"

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: pretty straightforward, no curve balls, lots of layers of administration to get through once hired though, physicians have to do their own credentialing which took a solid week and many re-submissions for every detail!
Interview Questions: standard for the time and type of job

title: Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening  with HR we discussed basic job description as well as salary range. Second interview was with hiring manager by phone lasted about an hour, the third and final interview was in person.
Interview Questions:
Describe research experience?
How do you manage multiple tasks at once?

title: New Grad Flex RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email from the HR recruiter regarding setting up a phone call.  She asked about my clinical experience and set up an in person interview with her and the hiring manager.  After interviewing with the manager, she set up another interview with charge nurses from day and night staff
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a patient or their family

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4+ months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Highland Park, IL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in person interview. The unit manager asked me how well i work with young co workers. I felt the question was very inappropriate and i withdrew my application . Im 56 years old and was very uncomfortable with this unit manager's interview questions twice during interview my age came up in a round about way.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with young co workers

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was half the day and I interviewed with 5 different people separately in succession over the course of several hours. I interviewed the the PI in charge of the study, 3 different coordinators, and the manager of the department.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to this position

title: Business Analyst, Preoperative Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied, obviously and was emailed for a phone interview. Interview went great and I was told to get a feedback after a week. After three follow-up emails with no  feedback, not sure why I even wasted my time to, I sent the last follow -up email and insisted on a feedback because it had been over a month. before I finally got a feedback. lengthy, unnecessary wait. It is high time that employers understand that prospective candidates also do not want their time wasted during a recruitment process. After a phone interview, as an employer you would know if you want to pursue a particular candidate or not. YOU DON'T NEED A WEEK OR TWO TO DECIDE! only one person gets hired for a role at the end of the day. The British recruitment process should be emulated. Very disappointing for such a reputable organization.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself an d walk me through your work experience
Elaborate on your skills and tools you have used?
Why did you decide to apply for this position?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at NorthShore was really long. There was a lot of waiting around for HR. First HR interviewed me for the position - basic phone screen to see what kind of personality I have. It took a very long time - almost 3 weeks - for me to hear anything back. Then I went in for an in-person interview, which felt more like a conversation about the position, day-to-day, and work hours. Overall it was a decent experience, but I wish there wasn't so much waiting time. I feel like NorthShore just has a very slow HR department. I ended up not getting an offer because they had a problem with their internal processes.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience using databases such as Excel?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview originally with my school. Originally it was pretty intimidating but once I had a one on one with the manager's it was much more relaxed.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email about a day later.  After a phone screen interview with HR, I was told they wanted to move forward to the next step.  Several days passed until they said they were trying to arrange the next interview.  Several more days passed and again they said they were trying to arrange the next interview.  Apparently, they are engaged with my company and had contacted them to get clearance to interview me.  I feel this was poorly handled.  They should have informed me of the relationship before contacting my employer.  Unfortunately North Shore University Health System  put me in an awkward position with my employer.  I immediately withdrew from consideration.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you disagreed with a team member and how your handled the situation.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to interview with heads of many medical departments. I filled out paperwork, interviewed with a panel, then finally with one of the dept.  I was called back within a week and was given an offer.
Interview Questions: What is the goal or goals you have when treating patients?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Glenview, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was average, but they are very selective with who they hire.  It took about 2 weeks for the whole thing. Also I had to take a PCT Competency test
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a difficult coworker and how you dealt with it

title: Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with volunteer head organizer and had a brief interview of why I wanted to volunteer. Other than that it was quite an easy interview to pass. Talked about my interests and some of the task I would have to do and be put in charge of.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the Medical Field?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly quick in my opinion. When I first arrived I had to do a few customer service test. Which were pretty easy. After I completed the test is had a brief interview with the recruiter and hopefully someone from HR would contact me this week.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and the process take 3 days.

I applied online and HR sent me an email to schedule a phone meeting. The phone meeting went well and she said she's going to ask hire manager to call me but it never happened. I sent email for follow up but didn't received response for another month saying they went for someone else who can start immediately.
Interview Questions: Going through resume

title: Patient Support Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: After sending resume I was contacted by email 3 weeks later. Had a phone interview and was asked to come in for face to face. After taking the computer tests I had an interview with the HR recruiter. I thought it went well. After the interview I was given all the folders regarding the company and she explained the next few steps. I was told the next interview person will be out of town for a week and will contact me on her return. I never heard from them again. Not even an email saying "sorry, the position was filled." Not very considerate since I had a face to face interview. Just never heard from them again and no one answered my email asking if the position had been filled. Not very professional.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry and frustrated patient?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR followed by Interview with department head. This was then followed up by a second interview with a different department head that I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you saw a nurse do something great for a patient?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went to two different interviews at two different places. Well worth it, but confusing at the time with parking and not knowing exactly where to go. Also made it difficult with my previous job, but I managed it. All of the people I met during my interviews were welcoming and friendly and I immediately felt like this would be a good place to work.
Interview Questions: How do you build trust with your managers and coworkers?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were a lot of interviews. First a telephone screening with a recruiter, than a telephone screening with an HR Rep from Northshore. Next was a typing, windows competency test, 2 customer service test. After you pass that you get invited to come back for another interview with the HR Rep and then you are brought down to the Patient Access Center where you shawdow a Rep and then you are interviewed again my two of the Patient Access managers. After that very long process you get an offer within a few days...or you don't.
Interview Questions: How does calling off effect the team.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with Human resources, then in person interview with multiple staff including research manager, principle investigator and possibly others. The questions were very straight forward and what you would expect from this type of interview process.
Interview Questions: How do you work in a team?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a phone interview right away.  Scheduled a meeting with HR and had a panel interview 2 weeks later.  Got a call back 3 days later, received a job offer the next day and started 3 weeks after that
Interview Questions: Explain a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Patient Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It is very easy and quick, I had the phone interview, then I had to take basic windows test and typing speed test. Now I'm waiting for in person interview with manager. This all happen within one week I applied. The HR department are absolutely friendly and very professional.
Interview Questions: Did you do anything without talking first with your supervisor?

title: Senior Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1) email from HR to set up a phone interview
2) phone interview with HR asking details about my background and describing the position
3) interview with hiring managers
4) second round interview with hiring managers 

This was my third interview with Northshore over the last several years.  Each interview experience was negative for different reasons.  

The first time HR completely disregarded my available start date documented on my application. I made it through several HR steps/interviews and it was never discussed. The hiring manager finally asked and the interview stopped immediately.  They were under the impression I could start immediately even though my application stated I couldn't start for a couple of months. 

The second time I never met with the HR recruiter because he was stuck in a meeting the whole time I was there. I took a few tests then had to wait 30 min before meeting with the hiring manager.  HR never collected the documents I was asked to bring to my interview.  

The last time HR asked me to take all the tests again,  even though I took them less then a week before. The HR rep said my results must have been lost.  That wasn't a huge deal.  The big reason for my negative experience was that the HR recruiter WOULD NOT tell me a pay range for the position. I asked 3 separate times at different points in the interview process. She said it was complicated and couldn't even give me a minimum hourly pay rate. The hiring managers also said they had no idea.  The whole situation was fishy. They kept asking me how much money I was looking for, but couldn't tell me if my request was even close to what the position pays.  I've never encountered a situation like this before.  I've interviewed with other managers and HR recruiters at Northshore and they all were able to tell me a pay range.
Interview Questions: What are your pay expectations? Are you flexible?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not extensive.  Manager was religious. I picked up on that and used it to my advantage.  I mentioned going to church with my grandmother in my youth. I also mentioned the values that my grandmother taught me.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself several years down the road?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Glenview, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: New Grad Residency Program. First I interviewed with the Nurse recruiter then floor manager. They were very amicable and the floor was neat. The process has 2 months training and rotation to the floor or sister ward. No benefits until final hire. They will pay more without benefits during the training and few dollars less with benefits.
Interview Questions: Clinical experience. Why nursing. Best and worst experience as student.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions:
easy; phone interview first; then on the day of the interview, i had to take a computer and skills test (easy); if you pass, you meet the HR rep who does a brief interview; once that is complete, you then meet some of the managers of the department. 
fairly easy process
Interview Questions: Scenario type questions....what did you do when you were in a difficult position/would have a difficult patient

title: Unit Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, record HR call after two dayseparate and was asked general questions. First face to face interview with HR manager after a week of phone interview, second face to face interview with unit manager, took one computer based typing test, offered given and accepted within same week.
Interview Questions: Why I want to work for Northshore hospital?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Its a long process, first you set up a time to take the entrance exam (if passed), then set up an interview within that interview, you interview with Human Resources then with the managers in patient access. If all is well you go and have a drug and physical test
Interview Questions:
What are your best qualities?
How does calling effect the group?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Was screened by HR, had to take a test to determine typing speed and basic computer knowledge (like how to work outlook) after that I was contacted by the practice manager for an interview. After interviewing with management I interviewed with the MD's I would be working for.
Interview Questions: What is your five year plan?

title: Unit Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was nothing out of the ordinary. I applied for the position and received a phone call. I came in for an interview with the recruiter. I spent time with her, met my manager, and then returned back to speak with the recruiter. I received an email the following week saying I have been accepted.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you went above and beyond at your work place?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from HR 1 week later after applying for a job posting. I got an interview the same week. On the interview day I took a mini computer test, then I interviewed with the recruiter and the unit manager.
Interview Questions: give an example of when you gave great customer service

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: it was a panel interview, met with all the nurse recruiters and the director, it was great to meet everyone, everyone was extremely nice.  it was the average interview
Interview Questions: What do you know about the magnet program?  HR questions.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
After a brief phone interview, I was scheduled for testing (typing and basic knowledge). After doing well on the test,  I was interviewed by in the HR office. She then brought me downstairs to Patient Access and the call center where I was interviewed again by a couple of the supervisors. Then I heard back in about a week with an offer. 

The questions asked during the phone interview were typical customer service and work ethic questions.  Those same questions were asked with HR face to face. Then downstairs,  I was asked again (by the two supervisors) about a time I gave great customer service as well as my strengths and weaknesses. The two supervisors in the last interview mostly got very descriptive about what I could expect and what's expected working in the call center.
Interview Questions: Tell us about one of your weaknesses on the job.

title: Flex Nurse (New Grad RN) - L & D Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I received a call to interview approximately 6 weeks after I applied for the position. She asked my availability and was able to accommodate me the same week. I arrived 30 minutes early, but walked around the hospital until I was it was only 15 minutes before my interview. I took a short (10-question) test on computer skills. I watched the woman who would eventually interview me take another candidate in to her office, which made this interviewer 30 minutes late for my interview. There was no where to hang my winter coat (it was snowing outside or I wouldn't have brought it!), so it was awkward to sit on it during the interview. The questions were not difficult, and I felt we had a good conversation. She explained the job and training and what benefits might be available to me once I transitioned into a position with benefits (flex nurse = 32 hours week, no benefits). The recruiter also explained that I would meet with the floor manager after our interview. If the floor manager liked me, she would have me and a couple other candidates come back to shadow a nurse on the floor for a morning.

When I met the floor manager, I felt that I had no connection with her. I handed her my class journals from my L&D experience, and I explained how women's health is my passion and my entire reason for changing careers. She explained that she was going to ask me five questions with no correct answers. They were typical behavioral-type questions. At one point during the interview (still holding my winter coat), she reached over to me to try to catch a "bug" above my head (nope, that was fluff from the winter coat I am still holding). There were lots of uncomfortable silences. I am a new ADN RN grad, but I have a Bachelor's degree in English and 12-plus years of experience in customer service and human resources. I handle lots of personalities well, but I think this manager was impossible to warm up to. I felt she was quiet so that I would open up and present her with "diarrhea of the mouth" in order to get rid of me. I wanted this job badly, and maybe I seemed desperate, but at one point toward the end I uttered, "I hope you like me" to which she said, "Well it's not a personality contest." As she was walking me out, there was a code in the hospital and the rapid response team ran over. She explained the code to me as though I had never been in a clinical situation before. I left the interview frustrated.

I followed up with thank-you cards to both the recruiter and to the manager, and I phoned the recruiter for an update to the timeline approximately 12 days after the interview. The recruiter was friendly and professional when she called me back and when she let me down the following week.  Although I think Evanston Hospital would be an amazing place to work, I felt it would be next to impossible to get this job. I did not even get invited back to shadow.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when your patient's status quickly deteriorated.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied in March and got a phone interview right away. It was followed by another phone interview. I was then offered an in person one on one interview. At this time I had to take a medicine dosage and typing test. Was told I'd be called if my resume caught any of the managers attention. I called back a month later and still nothing. Finally a couple months later after calling repeatedly I was offered to go to a panel interview. I met with five managers and got a call back that same day. Got an offer a week later and started two weeks after that.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screening with HR: they asked me what I knew about the position, and why I wanted to work for NorthShore. This interview required thorough knowledge of the position and the company.

In person interview: Met with HR, Lab Manager, Primary Investigator and the team. HR asked personality-type of questions. Interview with Lab Manager and PI felt more like a conversation. Probably wanted to see if I fit in with their team. Fellow RA and Project Manager asked me more skill-based questions.
Interview Questions:
"What was the best decision you ever made?"
"Describe a time you didn't agree with management. What did you do?"
"Tell me about yourself" (must answer with elevator pitch)

title: Senior Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process and an average interview. They ask you a lot of in depth questions about your background. They will also ask you questions on the skills they are looking for in the job description.
Interview Questions: Questions related to the job description

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is easy and smooth. I applied online, and I received a call from NorthShore recruiter the next day. She was very polite and kind. She asks me a couple of questions; then she scheduled me to be interviewed by unit manager.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was in a nice friendly setting. Not good with group interviews but they made me feel comfortable so i was not nervous. they asked about 5 questions non too hard to answer and to give experiences of past difficult encounters.
Interview Questions: what will i bring to northshore?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Glenview, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: You can only apply online, after you complete the process of applying online, you get a call back within 2 weeks. Next step is setting up interview, must be certified CNA/PCT. You will take a test when you come in for your interview. The test is about 10 questions long and have the same question type as the CNA test.  After you take the test, you will have an interview with 2 people the clinical nursing manager for the hospital and the nurse manager for the floor you applied for. The floor manager will go over the duties for your position and give you a tour of the unit. After interview is done, if you passed the test, and had a great interview you will hear from them within a week or less.
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you?

title: PSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: There were two process. One with an internal recruiter and if qualified, the second interview was with a practice manager. The entire process took about 2 months from submitting a resume to the actual interview, another week to start.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses ]?

title: RN Critical Care Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Manhasset, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of three interviews. The first interview took place with Talent Acquisition, the second with the nurse manager of the unit in which I was interviewing for, and the last was a panel interview with the nurse manager and staff members from the unit. The whole process took about 4 weeks in total.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions (Tell us about a time you had to make a difficult decision, Tell us about a time you used customer service) and a head to toe assessment with Talent Acquisition.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume.  Identified network contacts.  Network contact submitted resume to NorthShore.  HR screened me by phone and arranged for face-to-face meeting.  Met with leadership team.  Decision made within a few days.  I missed interviewing with current incumbants to understand daily routine.
Interview Questions: How would you address gaps in your background?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward dont look to much into it know your medical terms and know what a hospital setting is like . Also just be prepared to think logically. Interview process was very easy
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went through a job fair that the company was holding. Got a call back within a week to interview with HR and Managers for the department. Less than an hour later, I received a job offer.
Interview Questions: How well do you do under pressure?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Long bureaucratic process. After countless online submissions, First a phone interview with HR. Passing that hurdle, Then a second interview 1:1 live with HR. Passing that hurdle, Then a panel interview with 6 simultaneously. Passing that hurdle, successful candidates are then placed into a "Parking Lot" to which you apply/interview for an actual position. 
FYI…Found another management position at a different large health organization within a week of beginning interview process.
Interview Questions: How to handle doctor requests that you disagree with.

title: Digital Content Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting online I was interviewed over the phone twice, once by an HR admin and then by the hiring manager. I was then asked by the HR admin about my salary requirements and when I'd be free to come in for an in-person interview and then I never heard from anybody again, even after multiple follow-ups.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard fare about my prior experience, how I work in a team, my goals for the future.

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took forever (seriously, like 3 months) and involved first speaking with someone from HR who did a general screening; after passing that screening, I spoke directly with the person whom I would be replacing; I then met with the folks who would be working directly above and below me; finally, I met with the director of the division I would be joining.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with someone who is difficult to work with?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying online for the position, I received a response through email to set up A phone interview. After my phone interview I was told that I will have to do another phone interview that will last about 30 mins.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company?

title: Training Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: After I applied, I was contacted to come in for an interview with the department. I sat down with two ladies, for two job positions. Both of them fired questions to me and I answered. Some of it was conversational. Everything went smoothly!
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you experienced a conflict? How did you handle it? 
How would you prioritize phone and in person clients at the same time?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was really quick and the staff was super nic- I received a call the same exact day for them to make me an offer. They made it very easy. I interviewed with the HR staff and went on the the department manager the same day
Interview Questions: Why i applied for the position

title: Medical Assistant/Psa Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a call was asked a few questions and next day had interview with hiring manager for immediate care was a very easy interview, got hired the next day and took the job offer. After 2 weeks started orientation.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call after a month of online application submission. Interviewed with HR then to Managers who are very nice and professional. Offer was extended as soon as HR requirements fulfilled.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northshore?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: first phone interview by one person at HR then they told me someone else would call.  I had to contact them they never called.  They told me another person would call me which they did had another phone interview never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: What was your work experience.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions:
I first met with the Practice Manager for about 30 minutes. We went over general departmental workflows and what my role would be. I then sat with 3 of the current PCT's, which was a bit intimidating, for another 30-40 minutes. 

I got a call a few days later from the Practice Manager saying she would like me to come back in to meet the Physicians. That part of the interview process was very informal. They mostly asked where I was from and what my interests were. 

I got an offer call the next day.
Interview Questions: Before meeting with the practice in person, I had to go to a different location to take a computer test--typing speed, number of mistakes etc.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: I received an email with a request for a phone interview. The phone interview lasted about 30 minutes and covered my clinical experience and why I was choosing Northshore. I was invited for an in person interview at the end of the phone call and later that day received an email with interview times. I had an in person interview the next week and first met with the HR person who interviewed me over the phone and then a second meeting with the nurse managers from the floors I was interviewing for. Most questions were behavioral based "Tell me about a time where..." and they want examples of patient interactions and how you handled those situations. There were several of the basic "strengths and weakness" questions as well.
Interview Questions: "Why should we choose you over the other candidates we are interviewing"

title: Insurance Billing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: meeting with department manager she asked about my previous experience in the field, she advised what her expectations are from her unit. she also told me a bit about her professional personality is like. she advised me of how strong her personality is and that she is straightforward and doesn't play favorites with her team members.
Interview Questions: how well I work with others.

title: Patient Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview 
2. Typing and Computer test (pretty basic) just be able to type at least 30 wpm
3. In person interview with the particular location
* it was a really organized experience and I like the vibe that I got from all the people that I interacted with. They give chances to new college grads, which is a plus.*
Interview Questions: My interview was very relaxed , no question really got to me.

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter will schedule a phone interview, then a face to face with heads of the departments. All day interview. Will be spaced out, some managers may cancel day of depending on the schedule of the day.
Interview Questions: N/A straight forward questions

title: Hospital Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Glenview, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple, a little intimidating because you are being interview by three people at the same time. Process is pretty quick.
Interview Questions: None that I can actually think of. Pretty basic interview questions.

title: Patient Support Associate Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone interview
cpu proficiency screening
phone interview
in person interview
drug test/ tb screening
job offer
