title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: process by which an employer evaluates information about the pool of applicants generated during the recruitment phase. After assessing the candidates, the company decides which applicant will be offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing

title: Critical Care RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions:
They will questions regarding conflict resolution r/t patient, family ,members,co-workers.Recent initiative r/t cultural diversity and being sensitive to cultural beliefs."Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a co-worker or manager.What did you do to resolve, address the situation.Always fall back on corporate policy,yes CORPORATE(it is a business).
Care values.patient rights/responsibilities.Performance improvement in day of Medicare cutbacks,etc.Ways to save money while protecting patient outcomes.
Interview Questions: Many HR folks now ask " do you have any corrective action or performance improvement currently active in your chart? AWKWARD......

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Scheduling takes forever and when they finally do make an offer, pay is based on market value and years of experience. Leadership will conduct first interview, followed by interviewing with different team members. Lot of circles and running around before being made an offer.
Interview Questions: how long have you been searching for a new career?

title: RN Critical Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process. Prefer to hire from within. Meet with HR who asks normal strength/weakness type of questions. The HR interviewer was very easy to speak with. The manager was very frank and honest about the job expectations and their management style.
Interview Questions: I can't think of one. It was a while ago. But it is always good to come up with a weakness which can be turned into a strength.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview
2. Interview with HR manager, this inclues 3 tests
    typing at least 30 WPM
    Microsoft Word
    Microsoft Outlook
    Interview with HR manager
3. Interview with three different managers at the same time
Interview Questions: What is your worst quality or something you may need to work on?

title: Radiology Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: You get a call from HR to see if you meet the initial qualifications.  If you do, HR interviews you.  If they like you. your resume and their notes gets passed on to the manager.  They most definitely have an internal candidate for most clinical positions, so you sometimes go through all of this when they were only posting because they legally have to.
Interview Questions: They were your typical interview questions

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews one with the Manager and one with the team.  They are looking for someone that is very detail oriented and can manage challenging clients.  They want someone that is technology savvy and a quick learner.  This job requires project management and bringing up new offices.  Seemed to be a very nice team.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was with HR. Basic questions about your background. 2nd interview was with the leads and here the technical questions were asked. In the final interview there was another interview "behavioral" type questions.
Interview Questions: Questions were all straightforward. Nothing too difficult that stands out.

title: Senior Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem
Interview Descriptions: Extremely slow process.  Pressured me into sharing my previous salary.
Interview Questions: "How do you manager your time?"

title: Unit Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Highland Park, IL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty straightforward. First, you sit down with a hiring manager and go over what the position entails. Second, you sit down with the unit manager and the clinical coordinator and interview with them. If they take interest in you, you should hear back from them within a week.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? and what are your weaknesses?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a friendly interviewing process. I met with the women, we sat down, and she looked over my resume and asked me questions that she had about it. She asked me about my experience, education, and what I want to do in the future. If you are friendly, they will like you.
Interview Questions: What are you in school for?

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I went through six interviews when I originally applied. From the supervisor, manager, direction, two VPs, and the Controller. HR was no where near as attentive as management was. HR didn't even realize I was an internal applicant , even though NorthShore was on my resume.
Interview Questions: I was asked about how I would handle a particular accounting situation. Rather difficult because I had never worked as an accountant prior to this interview.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was a laid back interview- felt like more of a conversation. As I was a new grad, I was asked about my experience as a student and what I was interested in. The nurse recruiter was very nice and I felt at ease throughout the process.
Interview Questions: How do you think your patients would describe you?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Melville, NY) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was first screened by the recruiter from the recruiting agency, then I was phone screened by the HR Talent Recruiter at NSLIJ, then I had two onsite panel interviews.  Then I had a follow up phone interview.  There were a lot of people involved in the interview process, some were more prepared than others.  The entire process was quite lengthy and the time between each appointment was very long.  Most of the delay was due to the interviewers schedule.  It is difficult to get a panel on a single meeting.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?  The people are super talented, dedicated and caring.  It's ingrained in the culture of the line staff.

title: District Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with VP and then had a panel interview with peer department leaders.  I toured the facility and was able to ask questions of department leaders.  After initial interview, I returned to facility and met with department leaders that I would manage. Finally, I was selected as the final candidate and offered the position.
Interview Questions: How I will improve the quality of our service lines.

title: Cytology Clerical Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: A conversation about the duties of the position, my background, and career plans in the future. Before meeting with the department's manager, I underwent a brief skills test for Microsoft Outlook and basic Windows functions.
Interview Questions: How are you at multitasking and organization?

title: Regulatory Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Applied on the NorthShore website in Feb. Did not get a call about the specific position until early April. Had initial phone interview with HR/ Staffing - lasted about 30 minutes. Then, I was referred to the hiring manager for a phone interview a week later - which took 1hr 40mins. About 2 weeks later, I received an e-mail from HR/ Staffing that we would schedule an in-person interview with the hiring manager for the following month. The in-person interview consisted of meeting with HR/Staffing for 30 minutes for some general personality questions, and then the dept. hiring manager for about 1.5 hours for both general and work-specific questions. Received offer 2 days later.
Everyone involved seemed very nice, and I got the sense that there was a lot of camaraderie and respect for each other among organization staff. Everyone made sure to make a very big point out of their serivce values and customer care models - even noting that service values count for 50% of the position description and employee evaluation.
Interview Questions: Describe projects where you have shown initiative in the past.

title: Human Resources Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview, 1:1, Group Panel interviews.  Interviews went great, however, they internally hired someone, after making me wait a month, just to tell me, "best of luck". Please do not apply here, b/c they will waste your time. 
Stay Away!
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had a difficult situation, and how did you handle it?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview with HR, then the following week, had a phone interview with the statistician in the group, and then the next two weeks, had two 1:1 interviews with group members and director
Interview Questions: general statistics relatedl questions

title: Managed Care Contract Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Skokie, IL) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, two weeks later another phone interview with someone in the department, 2 weeks later,  in person interview with 3 people from the department.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you made a mistake and how you would have handled it differently.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Next, a phone interview.  Then, called in for an in-person interview with a medical group manager, and other employees.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected.  A bit unnerving to be constantly looked up and down.

title: Behavioral Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Merrick, NY) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple process, got a call came in to interview and received the offer about 2 weeks later which was not very long considering.  It was an easy process, not time consuming, interview was an hour or so.
Interview Questions: What made you want to come in to an interview with us?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very slow to get back to you. Months even.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses. Describe a difficult situation with your boss and how you handled it.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview and one hour long in-person interview with Section Supervisor and Director. Tour offices and speak with other staff. Learn about study procedures and population. Opportunity to ask questions and learn about the position. Very thoughtful selection process. Extremely qualified and knowledgeable staff.Two references requested and contacted.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to reach suburban communities in study with vehicle?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: The initial phone interview was fine, but then when meeting face to face with HR they made me wait for an hour in the waiting room, and then I interviewed with two people.  One was asking all the questions, while the other sat in the corner writing down what I suppose were my answers.  They were both very awkward, which made the whole process very awkward.  As far as interviews go, I thought it was very simple, and not very complicated.  We then toured around, met with the department manager, and then was all done.
Interview Questions: "If hired, how would you manage difficult situations?"

title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I initially had a phone interview, followed by two in-person interviews.  Each onsite interview consisted of three one-on-one interviews.  The interview questions were fairly standard, mostly behavioral and also a few questions about my past roles.  The people I met with were extremely welcoming and the culture seemed fairly relaxed.
Interview Questions: What is the accomplishment you are most proud of thus far in your professional career?

title: Research, Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem (Evanston, IL) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I was looking for entry level clinical and research experience to prepare for dental school. I applied online and through a contact at the office I was looking to work in. My initial conversation was with HR, then I was set up with an 1:1 interview. General questions were asked, such as how did you handle a work place issue with a colleague, how have you solved conflict, when have you exceeded expectations, etc. 
I then was asked to come into the HR office for a computer proficiency test. The next step was a drug screening. I started work the next month.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of how you solved conflict in the work place.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at NorthShore University HealthSystem in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Ridiculously juvenile due to the manager. Phlebotomy skills weren't asked about neither were my customer service skills.
Interview Questions: Management focused quite a bit on transportation availability and commute issues. Otherwise, toughest question was along the lines of how I would treat a different cultured patient with specific laws garnered to them.
